page.title: 15"Bowcombe"-Tourism.
page.content: Though{Bowcombe}is primarily an agricultural area, the Island economy depends heavily upon tourism, and inevitably its effects are felt indirectly if not directly; particularly in increased traffic during the Summer. The owner of Cheverton Farm expanded his interests into the Leisure Industry in 1936 when he set up his caravan site at nearbye Atherfield. In this respect he anticipated the much more recent trend of farmers to embark upon such ventures. Like farming, the Leisure Industry today is less labour intensive. "Once I employed 59 staff and accommodated 450 people. Now I only employ half a dozen for about half the number of people---People don't plan ahead these days. We get many of our bookings at short notice, even at the last minute"
